original_content:
VERSE FOR 5/2:_So let us come boldly to the throne of our gracious_
_God. There we will find __grace to help us when we_ _need it._ (Heb.
4:16) READ (Heb. 4:14-16)THOUGHT FOR TODAY:Prayer is our approach to
God, and we are to come "boldly." Some Christians approach God meekly
with heads hung low, afraid to ask Him to meet their needs.Others pray
flippantly giving little thought to what they say. Come with reverence
because He is your king. But also come with bold assurance because He
is your friend and counselor. WHEN LIFE NOCKS YOU DOWN YOU ARE IN A
PERFECT POSITION TO PRAY. _PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: Prayer is our approach to God, and we are to come "boldly." Some Christians approach God meekly with heads hung low, afraid to ask Him to meet their needs.Others pray flippantly giving little thought to what they say. Come with reverence because He is your king. But also come with bold assurance because He is your friend and counselor. WHEN LIFE KNOCKS YOU DOWN YOU ARE IN A PERFECT POSITION TO PRAY.
original_subject: A PLACE TO GO FOR HELP
original_verse_text: So let us come boldly to the throne of our gracious God. There we will find grace to help us when we need it.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with reverence and bold assurance, for You are our King and our Friend. In times of trial and difficulty, when life knocks us down, we find refuge in Your presence. Grant us the courage to approach Your throne of grace, that we may receive mercy and find grace to help in our time of need. Guide us by Your Spirit, and strengthen us to walk in Your ways. Amen.
reflection: Prayer is our approach to God, and we are to come “boldly.“ Some Christians approach God meekly with heads hung low, afraid to ask Him to meet their needs. Others pray flippantly, giving little thought to what they say. Come with reverence because He is your King. But also come with bold assurance because He is your friend and counselor. When life knocks you down, you are in a perfect position to pray.
subject: A Place to Go for Help
verse_text: So let us come boldly to the throne of our gracious God. There we will find grace to help us when we need it.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 5:3:Those who hope in the Lord will renew their strength
(Isa. 40:31) READ (Isa. 40:27-31)THOUGHT FOR TODAY:What is it like on
your journey today? IF fatigue has caused you to forget God's
presence and power, Why not pause and recall His promise._"Those_ _who
hope in the Lord will __renew their __strength._ (vs. 31) Now. Right
where you are. WHEN LIFE'S STRUGGLES MAKE YOU WEARY FINDSTRENGTH IN
THE LORD._ PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: What is it like on your journey today? IF fatigue has caused you to forget God's presence and power, Why not pause and recall His promise."Those who hope in the Lord will renew their strength. (vs. 31) Now. Right where you are. WHEN LIFE'S STRUGGLES MAKE YOU WEARY FIND STRENGTH IN THE LORD.
original_verse_text: Those who hope in the Lord will renew their strength.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You weary from the burdens of this life. Forgive us for forgetting Your steadfast presence and power. We thank You that those who hope in You will renew their strength, soaring on wings like eagles, running without growing weary, walking without being faint. Lord, grant us the grace to trust in Your unfailing might, that we may find our strength in You alone. Amen.
reflection: What is it like on your journey today? If fatigue has caused you to forget God's presence and power, why not pause and recall His promise? “Those who hope in the Lord will renew their strength.“ (vs. 31) Now. Right where you are. When life's struggles make you weary, find strength in the Lord.
subject: Strength for the Weary
verse_text: Those who hope in the Lord will renew their strength.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 5/4/2019:_If anyone serves, they should do so with the
strength God provides,__so that in all things God may be praised
through Jesus Christ. _(I Pet. 4:11) READ (I Pet. 4:7-11)THOUGHT FOR
TODAY:Remember God has created each of us for a specific purpose.
Primarily that purpose is to bring honor to Him, and one way we do
that is bymeeting the needs of others. (I Pet. 4:10-11) NOW Psalm 139
saysthat before we were born "_All the days ordained for [us} were
written __in His book."_ (vs. 16) We are fearfully and wonderfully
made" tobring glory to our creator. (14) NEVER FORGET: YOU HAVE A
PURPOSE._ PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: Remember God has created each of us for a specific purpose. Primarily that purpose is to bring honor to Him, and one way we do that is bymeeting the needs of others. (I Peter 4:10-11) NOW Psalm 139 saysthat before we were born "All the days ordained for [us} were written in His book." (vs. 16) We are fearfully and wonderfully made" tobring glory to our creator. (14) NEVER FORGET: YOU HAVE A PURPOSE.
original_verse_text: If anyone serves, they should do so with the strength God provides, so that in all things God may be praised through Jesus Christ.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that You have created each of us with a unique purpose. Help us to remember that our primary calling is to bring honor and glory to You. Guide us to faithfully use the gifts and abilities You have given us to meet the needs of others, so that in all things, You may be praised. May we never forget the truth that we are fearfully and wonderfully made, and that all our days have been ordained by Your hand. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Remember, God has created each of us for a specific purpose. Primarily, that purpose is to bring honor to Him, and one way we do that is by meeting the needs of others. (1 Peter 4:10-11) Now, Psalm 139 says that before we were born, “All the days ordained for [us] were written in His book.“ (v. 16) We are “fearfully and wonderfully made“ to bring glory to our Creator. (v. 14) Never forget: you have a purpose.
subject: You Have a Purpose
verse_text: If anyone serves, they should do so with the strength God provides, so that in all things God may be praised through Jesus Christ.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 5/5/2019:_Now this is eternal life: that they may know You,
__the only true God._ (Jn. 17:3) READ (Jn. 17:1-5)THOUGHT FOR
TODAY:WHO knew that Jesus's death on a Roman crosswould turn out to
reveal an eternal glory. WHO would have imagined that in the public
curse and the agony of the cross we would find eternal glory.WHO could
have foreseen that all of heaven andearth would one day sing, "Worthy
is the Lamb, who was slain, to receive power and wealth andwisdom and
strength and honor and glory andpraise!" LET US NOT FORGET, THAT THE
LAMB WHO DIED IS THE LORD WHO LIVES._ PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: WHO knew that Jesus's death on a Roman crosswould turn out to reveal an eternal glory. WHO would have imagined that in the public curse and the agony of the cross we would find eternal glory.WHO could have foreseen that all of heaven andearth would one day sing, "Worthy is the Lamb, who was slain, to receive power and wealth andwisdom and strength and honor and glory andpraise!" LET US NOT FORGET, THAT THE LAMB WHO DIED IS THE LORD WHO LIVES.
original_verse_text: Now this is eternal life: that they may know You, the only true God.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we stand in awe of the eternal glory revealed through the death of Your Son, Jesus Christ, on the cross. Who could have foreseen that the public curse and agony He endured would become the pathway to eternal life? We praise You, Lord, for the Lamb who was slain, yet now lives and reigns forever. May we never forget that the One who died is the Lord who lives. Amen.
reflection: WHO knew that Jesus's death on a Roman cross would turn out to reveal an eternal glory. WHO would have imagined that in the public curse and the agony of the cross we would find eternal glory. WHO could have foreseen that all of heaven and earth would one day sing, “Worthy is the Lamb, who was slain, to receive power and wealth and wisdom and strength and honor and glory and praise!“ Let us not forget that the Lamb who died is the Lord who lives.
subject: Who Knew--Who Imagined
verse_text: Now this is eternal life: that they may know You, the only true God.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 5/6/2019:_I KNOW, LORD, YOUR LAWS ARE RIGHTEOUS, AND THAT IS
__FAITHFULNESS YOU HAVE AFFLICTED ME._ (Psalm 119:75)READ (Psalm
119:71-75)THOUGHT FOR TODAY:Jesus is not a crouch for the weak. He IS
the sourceof new spiritual life! When we are broken, He can make us
new and whole. (Psalm 119:75)BROKENNESS CAN LEAD TO WHOLENESS.
original_reflection_text: Jesus is not a crouch for the weak. He IS the sourceof new spiritual life! When we are broken, He can make us new and whole. (Psalm 119:75) BROKENNESS CAN LEAD TO WHOLENESS.
original_verse_text: I KNOW, LORD, YOUR LAWS ARE RIGHTEOUS, AND THAT IS FAITHFULNESS YOU HAVE AFFLICTED ME.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging that Your ways are just and true, even when they lead us through the valleys of brokenness. We thank You that in our affliction, You have used it to teach us Your statutes, that we might grow in wisdom and understanding. Lord, mold us and shape us according to Your will, that our brokenness may lead to wholeness in You. May we ever trust in Your perfect plan, for we know that Your judgments are righteous. Amen.
reflection: Jesus is not a crutch for the weak. He is the source of new spiritual life! When we are broken, He can make us new and whole. (Psalm 119:75) Brokenness can lead to wholeness.
subject: Made New
verse_text: I KNOW, LORD, YOUR LAWS ARE RIGHTEOUS, AND THAT IS FAITHFULNESS YOU HAVE AFFLICTED ME.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 6/7/2017:_The man went way and began to tell . .__how much
Jesus had done for him._ (Mark 5:20)READ (Mark 5:1-20)THOUGHT FOR
TODAY:The man Jesus healed didn't need to preach a powerfulsermon; he
simply needed to share his story. No matter what our conversion
experience is, we can do what thatman did: [He} went away and began to
tell . how muchJesus had done for him. LET THE REDEEMED OF THE
LORD TELLTHEIR STORY. (PS. 107:2)_ PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: The man Jesus healed didn't need to preach a powerfulsermon; he simply needed to share his story. No matter what our conversion experience is, we can do what that man did: [He] went away and began to tell . how muchJesus had done for him. LET THE REDEEMED OF THE LORD TELL THEIR STORY. (Psalm 107:2)
original_verse_text: The man went way and began to tell . how much Jesus had done for him.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the power of Your Son, Jesus, to heal and redeem the broken. Like the man in Mark 5, may we joyfully proclaim the wondrous works You have done in our lives, that others may come to know the transforming love of Christ. May our testimonies be a light to the world, drawing all people to the salvation found in You. In Your Son's name we pray, Amen.
reflection: The man Jesus healed didn't need to preach a powerful sermon; he simply needed to share his story. No matter what our conversion experience is, we can do what that man did: he went away and began to tell how much Jesus had done for him. Let the redeemed of the Lord tell their story. (Psalm 107:2)
subject: Go Tell
verse_text: The man went way and began to tell . how much Jesus had done for him.

original_content:
VERSE FOR JUNE 8/2019_I desire to depart and be with Christ, which
__is __better by far. _(Phil. 1:23) READ (Phil. 1:12-26)_._THOUGHT FOR
TODAY:People who believe in the saving power of Jesus death and
resurrection will be with Him forever It has been said, ."all's well
that ends up in heaven."Whether we live or die, we win. "For to me, to
liveis Christ and to die is gain. (Phil. 1:21)BELIEF IN JESUS'S DEATH
AND RESURRECTION BRINGSTHE ASSURANCE OF LIFE WITH HIM FOR EVER._
PASTOR AL_____
original_reflection_text: People who believe in the saving power of Jesus death and resurrection will be with Him forever It has been said, ."all's well that ends up in heaven."Whether we live or die, we win. "For to me, to live is Christ and to die is gain. (Philippians 1:21)BELIEF IN JESUS'S DEATH AND RESURRECTION BRINGSTHE ASSURANCE OF LIFE WITH HIM FOR EVER.
original_verse_text: I desire to depart and be with Christ, which is better by far.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the assurance of eternal life with You through faith in Your Son, Jesus Christ. May our lives be a testament to the truth that “to live is Christ and to die is gain.“ As we journey through this world, keep our hearts and minds fixed on the promise of being with You forever. In the midst of life's trials, grant us the peace and hope that come from the power of Christ's death and resurrection. We eagerly await the day when we shall see You face to face. Amen.
reflection: People who believe in the saving power of Jesus' death and resurrection will be with Him forever. It has been said, “All's well that ends up in heaven.“ Whether we live or die, we win. “For to me, to live is Christ and to die is gain.“ (Philippians 1:21) BELIEF IN JESUS'S DEATH AND RESURRECTION BRINGS THE ASSURANCE OF LIFE WITH HIM FOREVER.
subject: Better by Far
verse_text: I desire to depart and be with Christ, which is better by far.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 5/9/2019:_In humility value others above yourselves, not
looking to __your own interests but each of you to the interests of
others._(Phil. 2:3-4) READ (Phil. 2:1-11)THOUGHT FOR TODAY:Other
people are not to be used for our own benefit. BECAUSEthey are loved
by God, as we are loved by Him.So we are to love one another, as e
loves us. His love is the greatest love of all. TRUE JOY COMES FROM
PUTTING ANOTHER'S NEEDS AHEAD OF OUR._ PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: Other people are not to be used for our own benefit. BECAUSE they are loved by God, as we are loved by Him. So we are to love one another, as he loves us. His love is the greatest love of all. TRUE JOY COMES FROM PUTTING ANOTHER'S NEEDS AHEAD OF OUR OWN.
original_verse_text: In humility value others above yourselves, not looking to your own interests but each of you to the interests of others.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, humbled by the example of Your Son, who emptied Himself and took the form of a servant. Help us to have the same mind as Christ, not seeking our own interests, but looking to the interests of others. May we be filled with Your love, that we may love one another as You have loved us. Grant us the grace to put the needs of our neighbors ahead of our own, that we may find true joy in serving You and one another. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Other people are not to be used for our own benefit. Because they are loved by God, as we are loved by Him. So we are to love one another, as He loves us. His love is the greatest love of all. True joy comes from putting another's needs ahead of our own.
subject: What Really Matters
verse_text: In humility value others above yourselves, not looking to your own interests but each of you to the interests of others.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 6/10/2019:_Oh, the joys _ _of those who do not follow the
__advice__ of the wicked, or stand around with __sinners, or join __in
with scoffers._(Ps.1:1) READ PS. 1:1-3THOUGHT FOR TODAY:In this
lifetime, it may not be possible to adequately seek the depths of the
book of Psalm,. Yet we need to start digging. The Psalm teach us to
pray, encourage us to trust, and invite us to dine at the table of
God's endless goodness.STARTING THIS WEEK:I WANT TO TAKE US THROUGH
THE PSALMS ONE VERSE OF EACH CHAPTER DAY BY DAY. _ PASTOR AL___
original_reflection_text: In this lifetime, it may not be possible to adequately seek the depths of the book of Psalm,. Yet we need to start digging. The Psalm teach us to pray, encourage us to trust, and invite us to dine at the table of God's endless goodness.STARTING THIS WEEK:I WANT TO TAKE US THROUGH THE PSALMS ONE VERSE OF EACH CHAPTER DAY BY DAY.
original_verse_text: Oh, the joys of those who do not follow the advice of the wicked, or stand around with sinners, or join in with scoffers.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, seeking to walk in the way of the righteous, as described in Psalm 1. May we delight in Your law and meditate on it day and night, taking root like a tree planted by streams of water, bearing fruit in due season. Guide us to avoid the counsel of the wicked and the path of sinners, that we may stand firm in Your presence. We trust in Your endless goodness and desire to dine at Your table, feasting on the riches of Your Word. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: In this lifetime, it may not be possible to adequately seek the depths of the book of Psalms. Yet we need to start digging. The Psalms teach us to pray, encourage us to trust, and invite us to dine at the table of God's endless goodness. Starting this week, I want to take us through the Psalms, one verse of each chapter, day by day.
subject: Together with God
verse_text: Oh, the joys of those who do not follow the advice of the wicked, or stand around with sinners, or join in with scoffers.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 6/11/2019:_The one enthroned in heaven laughs; the
Lord__scoffs at them._ (Ps. 2:4) READ (Ps. 2:1-5)THOUGHT FOR
TODAY:Wicked nations were plotting to overthrow God's anointed, thus
ultimately opposing the Almighty himself, and so He laughs. Is this a
heartless or cruel laughter? No! His same infinite greatness that
mocks man's defiance ALSO marks His sympathy with man in his lost
condition. God's laughter reminds us that Christ WILL ultimately
triumph over evil. REMEMBER MANKIND'S LIMITED POTENTIAL ACCENTS GOD'S
LIMITLESS POWER. _ PASTOR AL._
original_reflection_text: Wicked nations were plotting to overthrow God's anointed, thus ultimately opposing the Almighty himself, and so He laughs. Is this a heartless or cruel laughter? No! His same infinite greatness that mocks man's defiance ALSO marks His sympathy with man in his lost condition. God's laughter reminds us that Christ WILL ultimately triumph over evil. REMEMBER MANKIND'S LIMITED POTENTIAL ACCENTS GOD'S LIMITLESS POWER.
original_verse_text: The one enthroned in heaven laughs; the Lord scoffs at them.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we stand in awe of Your infinite power and sovereignty. Though the nations rage and the people plot in vain, we know that You sit enthroned in the heavens and laugh at their futile schemes. Your limitless might mocks our limited potential, yet Your heart is filled with compassion for the lost. May we find refuge in the triumph of Your anointed Son, Jesus Christ, who will one day reign victorious over all evil. Amen.
reflection: Wicked nations were plotting to overthrow God's anointed, thus ultimately opposing the Almighty Himself, and so He laughs. Is this a heartless or cruel laughter? No! His same infinite greatness that mocks man's defiance also marks His sympathy with man in his lost condition. God's laughter reminds us that Christ will ultimately triumph over evil. Remember mankind's limited potential accents God's limitless power.
subject: What Makes God Laugh?
verse_text: The one enthroned in heaven laughs; the Lord scoffs at them.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 6/12/2019_I lie down and sleep, I wake again, because __the
Lord sustains me. __I will not fear though __tens of thousands assail
me on every side._(Ps. 3:5-6) READ (Ps. 3:1-5)THOUGHT FOR TODAY:Do you
ever wake up in the morning to discover feelings of dread clouding
your mind? Some mornings we do wake up TO a very difficult day. When
this happens, we can either give in to despair or follow the example
of David. Faith, gratitude, and expectation will enable us to face the
most trying day with strong confidence in God. REMEMBER, THAT EVERY
DAY IS A GOOD DAY WHEN YOU ARE IN GOD'S WORD._ PASTOR AL___
____
original_reflection_text: Do you ever wake up in the morning to discover feelings of dread clouding your mind? Some mornings we do wake up TO a very difficult day. When this happens, we can either give in to despair or follow the example of David. Faith, gratitude, and expectation will enable us to face the most trying day with strong confidence in God. REMEMBER, THAT EVERY DAY IS A GOOD DAY WHEN YOU ARE IN GOD'S WORD.
original_verse_text: I lie down and sleep, I wake again, because the Lord sustains me. I will not fear though tens of thousands assail me on every side.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to you this day with hearts that may be heavy, but also with the assurance that you are our shield and our strength. Like David, we take refuge in you, for you alone can sustain us through the trials and tribulations we face. Help us to rest in the knowledge that our safety and security are found in your loving presence, and that with you, we can face each new day with confidence and hope. In your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: Do you ever wake up in the morning to discover feelings of dread clouding your mind? Some mornings we do wake up to a very difficult day. When this happens, we can either give in to despair or follow the example of David. Faith, gratitude, and expectation will enable us to face the most trying day with strong confidence in God. Remember, that every day is a good day when you are in God's word.
subject: Begin the Day with Hope
verse_text: I lie down and sleep, I wake again, because the Lord sustains me. I will not fear though tens of thousands assail me on every side.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 6/13/2017:_You have given me greater joy than those who have
an__abundant harvest of grain and wine._ (Ps. 4:7) READ (PS.
4:1-8)THOUGHT FOR TODAY:Changes of the heart can show up on the face.
BUT can changing our expression also help change our heart? Smiling
isn't the only thing we can do to change the way we feel. In Psalm 4,
we seewhen distress grips our soul , we can ask the Lord for relief
and mercy(v. 1). We can take comfort in knowing we are among those who
are favored by Him, remembering He hears us when we call (v. 3).We can
acknowledge our feelings and be quiet before Him (v. 4).We can do what
is right v. 5). And trust in Him to give us overflowinggladness (v.
7). And we can rest in the assurance of His peace andsafety (v. 8). A
HEART TOUCHED BY GRACE BRINGS JOY TO THE FACE._ PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: Changes of the heart can show up on the face. BUT can changing our expression also help change our heart? Smiling isn't the only thing we can do to change the way we feel. In Psalm 4, we seewhen distress grips our soul, we can ask the Lord for relief and mercy(v. 1). We can take comfort in knowing we are among those who are favored by Him, remembering He hears us when we call (v. 3).We can acknowledge our feelings and be quiet before Him (v. 4).We can do what is right v. 5). And trust in Him to give us overflowinggladness (v. 7). And we can rest in the assurance of His peace andsafety (v. 8). A HEART TOUCHED BY GRACE BRINGS JOY TO THE FACE.
original_verse_text: You have given me greater joy than those who have an abundant harvest of grain and wine.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You in our times of distress, seeking Your relief and mercy. We take comfort in knowing that we are favored by You and that You hear our cries. Help us to acknowledge our feelings, be still before You, and do what is right. Fill our hearts with Your overflowing gladness, that our faces may reflect the joy of Your grace. Grant us the assurance of Your peace and safety, that we may rest in You. Amen.
reflection: Changes of the heart can show up on the face. But can changing our expression also help change our heart? Smiling isn't the only thing we can do to change the way we feel. In Psalm 4, we see when distress grips our soul, we can ask the Lord for relief and mercy (v. 1). We can take comfort in knowing we are among those who are favored by Him, remembering He hears us when we call (v. 3). We can acknowledge our feelings and be quiet before Him (v. 4). We can do what is right (v. 5). And trust in Him to give us overflowing gladness (v. 7). And we can rest in the assurance of His peace and safety (v. 8). A heart touched by grace brings joy to the face.
subject: What's in a Smile?
verse_text: You have given me greater joy than those who have an abundant harvest of grain and wine.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 6/14/2019:_Hear my cry for help, my king and my God, for
to__You I cry._ (Ps. 5:2) READ (PS. 5:1-8)THOUGHT FOR TODAY:Charles
Spurgeon once wrote many years ago, "If you are not seeking the Lord,
the devil is seeking you." So we need to seek the Lord early and rely
on His, help being aware of the fact that the devil prowls around like
a roaring lion looking for someone to devour (Pet. 5:8) David came to
God early in the morning and ask Him for His protection and help. This
was David's regular practice. LET'S NOT MOVE INTO ANY DAY WITHOUT
BEING AWARE OFOUR URGENT NEED FOR THE LORD._ PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: Charles Spurgeon once wrote many years ago, "If you are not seeking the Lord, the devil is seeking you." So we need to seek the Lord early and rely on His, help being aware of the fact that the devil prowls around like a roaring lion looking for someone to devour (Peter 5:8) David came to God early in the morning and ask Him for His protection and help. This was David's regular practice. LET'S NOT MOVE INTO ANY DAY WITHOUT BEING AWARE OFOUR URGENT NEED FOR THE LORD.
original_verse_text: Hear my cry for help, my king and my God, for to You I cry.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You this day, aware of our desperate need for Your protection and guidance. Like David, we seek Your face early, knowing that the enemy prowls, seeking to devour us. Lord, we rely on Your steadfast love and faithfulness, for in You alone do we find true safety and security. Empower us by Your Spirit to walk in Your ways, that we may bring glory to Your name. Amen.
reflection: Charles Spurgeon once wrote many years ago, “If you are not seeking the Lord, the devil is seeking you.“ So we need to seek the Lord early and rely on His help, being aware of the fact that the devil prowls around like a roaring lion looking for someone to devour (1 Peter 5:8). David came to God early in the morning and asked Him for His protection and help. This was David's regular practice. Let's not move into any day without being aware of our urgent need for the Lord.
subject: Early Defense System
verse_text: Hear my cry for help, my king and my God, for to You I cry.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 6/15/2019:_Away from me, all you who do evil, for the Lord
__has heard my weeping._ (Ps. 6:8) READ (Ps. 6:1-9)THOUGHT FOR
TODAY:Sometimes it doesn't take much to get us down, does it?Yes life
can seem unbearable at times. But let us not let circumstances keep us
down. We need to meditate onGod's goodness to us, and talk to Him.
Knowing that He loves us and "accepts our prayer" (Ps. 6:9) will give
usstrength to help us get up when we're down. WHEN THINGS ARE LOOKING
DOWN, TRY LOOKING UP._ PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: Sometimes it doesn't take much to get us down, does it?Yes life can seem unbearable at times. But let us not let circumstances keep us down. We need to meditate onGod's goodness to us, and talk to Him. Knowing that He loves us and "accepts our prayer" (Psalm 6:9) will give usstrength to help us get up when we're down. WHEN THINGS ARE LOOKING DOWN, TRY LOOKING UP.
original_verse_text: Away from me, all you who do evil, for the Lord has heard my weeping.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You in our times of distress, when life seems unbearable and our circumstances weigh heavily upon us. Yet, we know that You are good and that You accept our prayers. Help us to meditate on Your love and faithfulness, that we may find the strength to rise up and look to You. May Your presence sustain us and Your peace guard our hearts, for we trust in Your unfailing love. Amen.
reflection: Sometimes it doesn't take much to get us down, does it? Yes, life can seem unbearable at times. But let us not let circumstances keep us down. We need to meditate on God's goodness to us and talk to Him. Knowing that He loves us and “accepts our prayer“ (Psalm 6:9) will give us strength to help us get up when we're down. When things are looking down, try looking up.
subject: When You're Down
verse_text: Away from me, all you who do evil, for the Lord has heard my weeping.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 6/16/2019:_Whoever digs a hole and scoops it out falls into
the pit__they have made._ (Ps. 7:15) READ (Ps. 7:11-17)THOUGHT FOR
TODAY:David wrote about danger we need to avoid. He said the timewould
come when the wicked would fall into their own pitbecause of their
ungodly ways. It may not happen right way.On the surface, everything
may seem to be going well with people who disregard God. But the
principle cannot be avoided:ANYONE who continually disobeys the Lord
is headed for afall. HOW IMPORTANT, THEN, TO LIVE BY THE PRINCIPLES OF
GOD'S WORD._ PASTOR AL___
original_reflection_text: David wrote about danger we need to avoid. He said the timewould come when the wicked would fall into their own pitbecause of their ungodly ways. It may not happen right way.On the surface, everything may seem to be going well with people who disregard God. But the principle cannot be avoided:ANYONE who continually disobeys the Lord is headed for afall. HOW IMPORTANT, THEN, TO LIVE BY THE PRINCIPLES OF GOD'S WORD.
original_verse_text: Whoever digs a hole and scoops it out falls into the pit they have made.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging the truth revealed in Your Word. As we reflect on the fate of the wicked who disregard Your ways, we are reminded of the importance of aligning our lives with Your righteous principles. Lord, grant us the wisdom and discernment to walk in Your ways, that we may not fall into the pits of our own making. May we ever be vigilant, keeping our eyes fixed on You, the source of all truth and goodness. In Your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: David wrote about danger we need to avoid. He said the timewould come when the wicked would fall into their own pitbecause of their ungodly ways. It may not happen right way.On the surface, everything may seem to be going well with people who disregard God. But the principle cannot be avoided:ANYONE who continually disobeys the Lord is headed for afall. HOW IMPORTANT, THEN, TO LIVE BY THE PRINCIPLES OF GOD'S WORD.
subject: Danger Below
verse_text: Whoever digs a hole and scoops it out falls into the pit they have made.

VERSE FOR 6/17/2019:_What is man that You are mindful of him, and the
son of__man that You visit him_? (Ps. 8:4) READ (Ps. 8)THOUGHT FOR
TODAY:Think of the question that was ask:_ What is man that You are
mindful__of him?_ What came to mind here is that the earth is a mere
speck ofdust traveling through the vast expanse of space, And we are
the passengers,in hardily noticeable, BUT GOD, is not like man. His
power is so great thatHe sees us. He knows us. He cares for us. He
seeks us. He meets our need.YES, this powerful God loves us. When I
think how small and helplesswe are in God's expansive and awesome
creation, I'm thankful that His love is as great as His power (GOD
LOVES US NOT BECAUSE OF WHO WE ARE BUT BECAUSE OF WHO HE IS)_ PASTOR
AL_
original_reflection_text: Think of the question that was ask: What is man that You are mindfulof him? What came to mind here is that the earth is a mere speck ofdust traveling through the vast expanse of space, And we are the passengers,in hardily noticeable, BUT GOD, is not like man. His power is so great thatHe sees us. He knows us. He cares for us. He seeks us. He meets our need.YES, this powerful God loves us. When I think how small and helplesswe are in God's expansive and awesome creation, I'm thankful that His love is as great as His power (GOD LOVES US NOT BECAUSE OF WHO WE ARE BUT BECAUSE OF WHO HE IS)
original_subject: PASSENGERS ON A SPECK OF DUST
original_verse_text: What is man that You are mindful of him, and the son of man that You visit him?
prayer: Heavenly Father, we stand in awe of Your majesty and power, for the heavens declare Your glory and the skies proclaim the work of Your hands. Yet, in Your infinite wisdom, You have crowned us with glory and honor, entrusting us to steward Your creation. Help us to walk humbly before You, ever mindful of Your great love that surpasses our understanding. May we live as faithful servants, reflecting Your compassion and grace to all. Amen.
reflection: Think of the question that was ask: What is man that You are mindfulof him? What came to mind here is that the earth is a mere speck ofdust traveling through the vast expanse of space, And we are the passengers,in hardily noticeable, BUT GOD, is not like man. His power is so great thatHe sees us. He knows us. He cares for us. He seeks us. He meets our need.YES, this powerful God loves us. When I think how small and helplesswe are in God's expansive and awesome creation, I'm thankful that His love is as great as His power (GOD LOVES US NOT BECAUSE OF WHO WE ARE BUT BECAUSE OF WHO HE IS)
subject: Passengers on a Speck of Dust
verse_text: What is man that You are mindful of him, and the son of man that You visit him?

original_content:
VERSE FOR 6/18/2019:_Those who know Your name trust in You, for You,
Lord,__have never forsaken those who seek You._ (Ps. 9:10)READ (Ps.
9:1-10)THOUGHT FOR TODAY:Sometimes the answer to our prayers don't
come when we wish they would. Waiting is not always easy, but the end
result, what ever it is, WILL be worth it. David put it this way,
"_Those who know __your name trust in You, for __You, Lord, have never
forsaken those __who seek You. _(Ps. 9:10) The beat advice is: Time
spent in prayer IS ALWAYS time well spent KEEP SEEKING, KEEP TRUSTING,
KEEP ASKING, KEEP PRAYING._ PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: Sometimes the answer to our prayers don't come when we wish they would. Waiting is not always easy, but the end result, what ever it is, WILL be worth it. David put it this way, "Those who know your name trust in You, for You, Lord, have never forsaken those who seek You. (Psalm 9:10) The beat advice is: Time spent in prayer IS ALWAYS time well spent KEEP SEEKING, KEEP TRUSTING, KEEP ASKING, KEEP PRAYING.
original_verse_text: Those who know Your name trust in You, for You, Lord, have never forsaken those who seek You.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that those who know Your name trust in You. Even when the answers to our prayers seem delayed, we cling to the promise that You have never forsaken those who seek You. Lord, help us to persevere in prayer, to keep seeking, trusting, and asking, for we know that time spent with You is never wasted. May our faith in You grow stronger as we wait upon Your perfect timing and will. Amen.
reflection: Sometimes the answer to our prayers don't come when we wish they would. Waiting is not always easy, but the end result, what ever it is, WILL be worth it. David put it this way, “Those who know your name trust in You, for You, Lord, have never forsaken those who seek You. (Psalm 9:10) The beat advice is: Time spent in prayer IS ALWAYS time well spent KEEP SEEKING, KEEP TRUSTING, KEEP ASKING, KEEP PRAYING.
subject: Four K's
verse_text: Those who know Your name trust in You, for You, Lord, have never forsaken those who seek You.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 6/19/2019:_But You, God, see the trouble of the afflicted;
__You consider their __grief and take it in hand. The __the victims
commit themselves __to You; You are_ _the helper of the fatherless._
(Ps. 10:14) READ(Ps. 10:1-15)THOUGHT FOR TODAY:There is so much on the
news today, about young people being kidnaped & killed. WHY do the
young people keep dying at the hands of ruthless killers? The answer
can be found in Ps. 10. The wicked act horribly because, in their
thoughts there is no room for God. (v. 4) "From ambush he murders the
innocent." (v. 8) Thinking, "God will never notice" (v. 11). Murder
and violence result when people don't think God sees or cares what
they do. BUTGod does, and He will avenge the murder of the innocent
(Vs. 14-15). WE CAN BE ASSURED THAT GOD'S JUSTICE WILL PREVAIL._
PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: There is so much on the news today, about young people being kidnapped & killed. WHY do the young people keep dying at the hands of ruthless killers? The answer can be found in Psalm 10. The wicked act horribly because, in their thoughts there is no room for God. (v. 4) "From ambush he murders the innocent." (v. 8) Thinking, "God will never notice" (v. 11). Murder and violence result when people don't think God sees or cares what they do. BUTGod does, and He will avenge the murder of the innocent (Vs. 14-15). WE CAN BE ASSURED THAT GOD'S JUSTICE WILL PREVAIL.
original_subject: GOD HAS HIS EYE ON YOU
original_verse_text: But You, God, see the trouble of the afflicted; You consider their grief and take it in hand. The victims commit themselves to You; You are the helper of the fatherless.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with heavy hearts as we witness the tragic loss of innocent lives, especially among the young. Your Word in Psalm 10 reveals the root of such evil - a denial of Your presence and a disregard for Your justice. Lord, we cry out for Your intervention, for Your eyes to see the plight of the oppressed, and for Your hand to bring righteous judgment upon the wicked. May Your justice and mercy prevail, and may Your people find comfort in the assurance that You will not forget the needy. We trust in Your sovereign plan, even in the face of such darkness. Amen.
reflection: There is so much on the news today, about young people being kidnapped & killed. WHY do the young people keep dying at the hands of ruthless killers? The answer can be found in Psalm 10. The wicked act horribly because, in their thoughts there is no room for God. (v. 4) “From ambush he murders the innocent.“ (v. 8) Thinking, “God will never notice“ (v. 11). Murder and violence result when people don't think God sees or cares what they do. BUTGod does, and He will avenge the murder of the innocent (Vs. 14-15). WE CAN BE ASSURED THAT GOD'S JUSTICE WILL PREVAIL.
subject: God Has His Eye on You
verse_text: But You, God, see the trouble of the afflicted; You consider their grief and take it in hand. The victims commit themselves to You; You are the helper of the fatherless.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 6/20/2019:_How long, Lord? Will You forget me forever?__How
long will You hide Your face from me?_(Ps. 13:1) READ (Ps.
13:1-6)THOUGHT FOR TODAY:A spiritual slump can make us feel forsaken
byGod. We struggle with troubling thoughts. ourhearts become
sorrowful. We're sure that we'refighting a losing battle. Are you in a
slump? plead with God, trust Him, and praise His name.Then get back in
the game. FEED YOUR FAITH ANDYOUR DOUBTS WILL STARVE TO DEATH._ PASTOR
AL___
____
original_reflection_text: A spiritual slump can make us feel forsaken byGod. We struggle with troubling thoughts. ourhearts become sorrowful. We're sure that we'refighting a losing battle. Are you in a slump? plead with God, trust Him, and praise His name.Then get back in the game. FEED YOUR FAITH ANDYOUR DOUBTS WILL STARVE TO DEATH.
original_verse_text: How long, Lord? Will You forget me forever? How long will You hide Your face from me?
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You in our times of despair, when it feels as though You have forgotten us. Our hearts are heavy, and our thoughts are troubled, but we know that You are ever-present, watching over us. Lord, we trust in Your unfailing love and cling to the promise that You will never abandon us. Fill us with the strength to persevere, and may our praise for Your name overcome our doubts. Amen.
reflection: A spiritual slump can make us feel forsaken by God. We struggle with troubling thoughts. Our hearts become sorrowful. We're sure that we're fighting a losing battle. Are you in a slump? Plead with God, trust Him, and praise His name. Then get back in the game. Feed your faith and your doubts will starve to death.
subject: Spiritual Slump
verse_text: How long, Lord? Will You forget me forever? How long will You hide Your face from me?

original_content:
VERSE FOR 6/21/2019:_How long must I wrestle with my thoughts and__day
after day have sorrow in my heart?_(Ps. 13:2) REREAD (Ps.
13:1-6)THOUGHT FOR TODAY:In Ps. 13 David expresses his grief, he
addressesGod with raw and honest words, "How long,Lord?" I believe
we've all had dark times, whenwe wonder if God has abandoned us. But
likeDavid, our aching can give way to joy when we approach God
honestly, plead for help, and reaffirmour trust in a God whose love
for us will never waver or change. Let us keep these three thoughtsin
mind: SORROW LOOKS BACK--WORRY LOOKS AROUND--AND--FAITH LOOKS UP._
PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: In Psalm 13 David expresses his grief, he addressesGod with raw and honest words, "How long,Lord?" I believe we've all had dark times, whenwe wonder if God has abandoned us. But likeDavid, our aching can give way to joy when we approach God honestly, plead for help, and reaffirmour trust in a God whose love for us will never waver or change. Let us keep these three thoughtsin mind: SORROW LOOKS BACK--WORRY LOOKS AROUND--AND--FAITH LOOKS UP.
original_verse_text: How long must I wrestle with my thoughts and day after day have sorrow in my heart?
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with hearts heavy with sorrow, like David in Psalm 13. We cry out, “How long, O Lord?“ wondering if You have forgotten us. Yet, we know that Your love for us is steadfast and true. Help us to look up to You in faith, to trust in Your unfailing care, and to find joy in Your presence, even in our darkest moments. We cling to the promise that You will not abandon us, but will sustain us with Your steadfast love. Amen.
reflection: In Psalm 13, David expresses his grief. He addresses God with raw and honest words, “How long, O Lord?“ I believe we've all had dark times when we wonder if God has abandoned us. But like David, our aching can give way to joy when we approach God honestly, plead for help, and reaffirm our trust in a God whose love for us will never waver or change. Let us keep these three thoughts in mind: SORROW LOOKS BACK, WORRY LOOKS AROUND, AND FAITH LOOKS UP.
subject: Not Abandoned
verse_text: How long must I wrestle with my thoughts and day after day have sorrow in my heart?

original_content:
VERSE FOR 6/22/2019:_Lord, who may dwell in Your sacred tent? Who
__may live on Your holy mountain? __The one whose __walk is blameless,
who does what is righteous, __who speaks the __truth from their
heart._ (Ps.15:1-2) READ (Ps. 15:1-5)THOUGHT FOR TODAY:In the first
verse of Ps. 15 David asked, what kind of person could live in God's
holy presence. In the second verse he answers his own question, it is
one whose walk is blameless, a person of integrity. Have you examined
your integrity? Does your integrity stand the test of living honestly
day by day? DAVID SAID THAT IF WE DO, WE WILL NEVER BE SHAKEN
(15:5)._ PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: In the first verse of Psalm 15 David asked, what kind of person could live in God's holy presence. In the second verse he answers his own question, it is one whose walk is blameless, a person of integrity. Have you examined your integrity? Does your integrity stand the test of living honestly day by day? DAVID SAID THAT IF WE DO, WE WILL NEVER BE SHAKEN (15:5).
original_verse_text: Lord, who may dwell in Your sacred tent? Who may live on Your holy mountain? The one whose walk is blameless, who does what is righteous, who speaks the truth from their heart.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, seeking to walk in a manner worthy of Your presence. Search our hearts and reveal any areas where our integrity falls short, that we may repent and live with blameless conduct. Grant us the strength to stand firm in our commitment to honesty and righteousness, that we may never be shaken, but find refuge in Your holy dwelling. May our lives reflect the character of Christ, to Your glory. Amen.
reflection: In the first verse of Psalm 15, David asked what kind of person could live in God's holy presence. In the second verse, he answers his own question: it is one whose walk is blameless, a person of integrity. Have you examined your integrity? Does your integrity stand the test of living honestly day by day? David said that if we do, we will never be shaken (15:5).
subject: Rock Solid Integrity
verse_text: Lord, who may dwell in Your sacred tent? Who may live on Your holy mountain? The one whose walk is blameless, who does what is righteous, who speaks the truth from their heart.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 6/23/2019:_Therefore my heart is glad and my tongue
rejoices;__my body also will rest secure. _(Ps. 16:9) READ(Ps.
16:1:11)THOUGHT FOR TODAY: If you noticed, David said, that there was
no treasure more valuable than a personal relationship with God. (vs.
2, 5). I hope this has been your experience. ONLY because of Jesus's
own death and resurrection, we too will rise one day (Acts 2:25-28 And
we will find in heaven "eternal pleasures"(Ps. 16:11 NKJV)._ PASTOR
AL_
original_reflection_text: If you noticed, David said, that there was no treasure more valuable than a personal relationship with God. (vs. 2, 5). I hope this has been your experience. ONLY because of Jesus's own death and resurrection, we too will rise one day (Acts 2:25-28 And we will find in heaven "eternal pleasures"(Psalm 16:11 NKJV).
original_verse_text: Therefore my heart is glad and my tongue rejoices; my body also will rest secure.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that You alone are our greatest treasure. In the midst of the trials and tribulations of this world, we find refuge and joy in the security of Your presence. Lord, we thank You for the promise of eternal life, made possible through the death and resurrection of Your Son, Jesus. May our hearts ever rejoice and our souls find rest in the eternal pleasures that await us in Your kingdom. We look forward to the day when we shall rise and dwell with You forever. Amen.
reflection: If you noticed, David said that there was no treasure more valuable than a personal relationship with God (vs. 2, 5). I hope this has been your experience. Only because of Jesus's own death and resurrection, we too will rise one day (Acts 2:25-28), and we will find in heaven “eternal pleasures“ (Psalm 16:11 NKJV).
subject: Awaiting Treasures with No Comparison
verse_text: Therefore my heart is glad and my tongue rejoices; my body also will rest secure.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 6/24/19:_In my distress I called to the Lord; I cried to
my__God for help. from His temple He heard my voice;__my cry came
before Him, into His ears._ (Ps. 18:8)READ (Ps. 18:1-8)THOUGHT FOR
TODAY GOD WAS A FOR:David could say, "I love You, Lord" because
heunderstood God was a fortress, a rock, and a deliver (vs. 1-2). God
was his shield, his salvation, and his stronghold. Maybe we have a
hard time understanding David's praise because we have not experienced
God's help. Is it because we reach for the phone before going to God
for advice and help._ PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: David could say, "I love You, Lord" because he understood God was a fortress, a rock, and a deliver (vs. 1-2). God was his shield, his salvation, and his stronghold. Maybe we have a hard time understanding David's praise because we have not experienced God's help. Is it because we reach for the phone before going to God for advice and help.
original_verse_text: In my distress I called to the Lord; I cried to my God for help. from His temple He heard my voice; my cry came before Him, into His ears.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, for You are our rock, our fortress, and our deliverer. Like David, we declare our love for You, for You have been our shield, our salvation, and our stronghold in times of need. Forgive us for the times when we have turned to the world instead of seeking Your guidance and strength. May we ever fix our eyes on You, the source of our help and hope. In Your mighty name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: David could say, “I love you, Lord,“ because he understood God was a fortress, a rock, and a deliverer (vs. 1-2). God was his shield, his salvation, and his stronghold. Maybe we have a hard time understanding David's praise because we have not experienced God's help. Is it because we reach for the phone before going to God for advice and help?
subject: A Direct Line
verse_text: In my distress I called to the Lord; I cried to my God for help. from His temple He heard my voice; my cry came before Him, into His ears.

original_content:
VERSE FOR6/25/19:_The heavens declare the glory of God; the
skies__proclaim the work of His hands._ (Ps. 19:1) READ(Ps.
19:1-4)THOUGHT FOR TODAY:What is truly interesting is the fact that
God hastaken a personal interest in us. that is truly fascinating when
you think about the universe He created. The earth has a perfect
amount of oxygen and nitrogen to sustain mankind. There are many other
facts about the universethat I don't have the room to explain that
makes man seem quiet insignificant yet God had such a love for us that
He sent His own Son to die for our sins. YES ALL CREATION IS AN
OUTSTRETCHED FINGER POINTING TOWARD GOD._ PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: What is truly interesting is the fact that God hastaken a personal interest in us. that is truly fascinating when you think about the universe He created. The earth has a perfect amount of oxygen and nitrogen to sustain mankind. There are many other facts about the universethat I don't have the room to explain that makes man seem quiet insignificant yet God had such a love for us that He sent His own Son to die for our sins. YES ALL CREATION IS AN OUTSTRETCHED FINGER POINTING TOWARD GOD.
original_verse_text: The heavens declare the glory of God; the skies proclaim the work of His hands.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we stand in awe of Your magnificent creation, which declares the glory of Your handiwork. The vastness of the universe and the intricate design of all that You have made point us to Your power, wisdom, and love. Yet, in Your unfathomable grace, You have chosen to take a personal interest in us, sending Your Son to die for our sins. May we respond with hearts of worship and gratitude, marveling at the way Your outstretched finger draws us to Yourself. Amen.
reflection: What is truly interesting is the fact that God has taken a personal interest in us. That is truly fascinating when you think about the universe He created. The earth has a perfect amount of oxygen and nitrogen to sustain mankind. There are many other facts about the universe that I don't have the room to explain that make man seem quite insignificant, yet God had such a love for us that He sent His own Son to die for our sins. YES, ALL CREATION IS AN OUTSTRETCHED FINGER POINTING TOWARD GOD.
subject: Our Great God
verse_text: The heavens declare the glory of God; the skies proclaim the work of His hands.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 6/26/19:_Some trust in chariots and some in horses, but we
__trust __in the name of the Lord our God._ (Ps.20:7) READ (Ps.
20)THOUGHT FOR TODAY:Where have you placed your trust? In (Ps. 20:7)
David says, "Some trust in chariots and some in horses, but wetrust in
the name of the Lord our God." Chariots and horsesrepresent material
and human assets. They may be useful in our daily life, but they don't
give us security in times oftrouble. Those who trust in their chariots
and horses can be"brought to their knees and fall," BUT those who
trust in Godwill "rise up and stand firm" (v. 8)IN A WORLD OF CHANGE,
WE CAN TRUST OUR UNCHANGING GOD._ PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: Where have you placed your trust? In (Psalm 20:7) David says, "Some trust in chariots and some in horses, but wetrust in the name of the Lord our God." Chariots and horsesrepresent material and human assets. They may be useful in our daily life, but they don't give us security in times oftrouble. Those who trust in their chariots and horses can be"brought to their knees and fall," BUT those who trust in Goodwill "rise up and stand firm" (v. 8)IN A WORLD OF CHANGE, WE CAN TRUST OUR UNCHANGING GOD.
original_verse_text: Some trust in chariots and some in horses, but we trust in the name of the Lord our God.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that our trust should not be in the fleeting things of this world, but in Your eternal and unchanging name. Help us to lean not on our own understanding, but to trust in You with all our hearts, knowing that You will direct our paths according to Your perfect will. May we find our security and strength in You alone, for You are our rock and our salvation. Amen.
reflection: Where have you placed your trust? In (Psalm 20:7) David says, “Some trust in chariots and some in horses, but wetrust in the name of the Lord our God.“ Chariots and horsesrepresent material and human assets. They may be useful in our daily life, but they don't give us security in times oftrouble. Those who trust in their chariots and horses can be“brought to their knees and fall,“ BUT those who trust in Goodwill “rise up and stand firm“ (v. 8)IN A WORLD OF CHANGE, WE CAN TRUST OUR UNCHANGING GOD.
subject: Misplace Trust
verse_text: Some trust in chariots and some in horses, but we trust in the name of the Lord our God.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 6/27/19:_Take delight in the Lord, and He will give you_
_the __desires of your heart._ (Ps. 37:4) REREAD (Ps. 21:1-7)THOUGHT
FOR TODAY:It is natural to spend time thinking about where we'd like
to be or what we'd like to be, but let us rememberto always reevaluate
our desires to make sure they are consistent with what God says will
truly satisfy. Whenour desires conform to God's will, we're not likely
to waste time wishing for things that can't satisfy. REAL JOY COMES
NOT IN GETTING WHAT WE WANT, BUT INWANTING TO BE CLOSE TO GOD._ PASTOR
AL_
original_reflection_text: It is natural to spend time thinking about where we'd like to be or what we'd like to be, but let us remember to always reevaluate our desires to make sure they are consistent with what God says will truly satisfy. Whenour desires conform to God's will, we're not likely to waste time wishing for things that can't satisfy. REAL JOY COMES NOT IN GETTING WHAT WE WANT, BUT INWANTING TO BE CLOSE TO GOD.
original_verse_text: Take delight in the Lord, and He will give you the desires of your heart.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that true joy and satisfaction are found in desiring to be close to You. Help us to align our desires with Your perfect will, that we may find fulfillment in seeking Your face and delighting in Your presence. May our hearts be steadfast in trusting in Your goodness and faithfulness, for You alone can satisfy the longings of our souls. We give You all the glory and praise. Amen.
reflection: It is natural to spend time thinking about where we'd like to be or what we'd like to be, but let us remember to always reevaluate our desires to make sure they are consistent with what God says will truly satisfy. When our desires conform to God's will, we're not likely to waste time wishing for things that can't satisfy. Real joy comes not in getting what we want, but in wanting to be close to God.
subject: Evaluating Our Desires
verse_text: Take delight in the Lord, and He will give you the desires of your heart.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 6/28/19:_The Lord is my shepherd, I lack nothing._ (Ps.
23:1)READ Psalm 23 once again!THOUGHT FOR TODAY:If you're a worrier,
there's hope for you. Rick Warren,the author of _The purpose Driven
Life, _wrote: "When you think about a problem over and over in your
mind, that's called worry .When you think about God's Word over and
over in your mind, that's _meditation._ The more we meditate on God's
Word the less we need to worry.GOD USES THOSE WHO CAN HONESTLY SAY,
"THE LORD IS MY SHEPHERD." _ PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: If you're a worrier, there's hope for you. Rick Warren,the author of The purpose Driven Life, wrote: "When you think about a problem over and over in your mind, that's called worry .When you think about God's Word over and over in your mind, that's meditation. The more we meditate on God's Word the less we need to worry.GOD USES THOSE WHO CAN HONESTLY SAY, "THE LORD IS MY SHEPHERD."
original_verse_text: The Lord is my shepherd, I lack nothing.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that You are our Shepherd who provides for all our needs. In times of worry and anxiety, help us to meditate on Your Word, finding peace and comfort in the truth that You are in control. May we cast our cares upon You, trusting that Your perfect peace will guard our hearts and minds. We give thanks for Your constant care and guidance, Lord. Amen.
reflection: If you're a worrier, there's hope for you. Rick Warren, the author of The Purpose Driven Life, wrote: “When you think about a problem over and over in your mind, that's called worry. When you think about God's Word over and over in your mind, that's meditation. The more we meditate on God's Word, the less we need to worry. God uses those who can honestly say, “The Lord is my shepherd.“
subject: Hope for Worriers
verse_text: The Lord is my shepherd, I lack nothing.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 6/29/19:WHO may ascend the mountain of the Lord?WHO may
stand in His holy place? THE ONEwho has clean hands and a pure heart,
WHOdoes not trust in an idol or swear by a false god.(Ps. 24:3-4) READ
ALL OF (Ps. 24)THOUGHT FOR TODAY:Wherever we go now days we see signs
encouraging us to wash our hands. We see in these two vss. that David
spoke of the importance of clean hands, but for a very different
reason. HERE "CLEAN HANDS," is notin reference to personal hygiene BUT
a metaphor for our spiritual condition being cleansed from sin. (I Jn.
1:9) IT SPEAKS OF A LIFE COMMITTED TO WHAT IS RIGHT AND GODLY ENABLING
US TO STAND BEFORE OUR LORD IN THE PRIVILEGE OF WORSHIP._ PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: Wherever we go now days we see signs encouraging us to wash our hands. We see in these two vss. that David spoke of the importance of clean hands, but for a very different reason. HERE "CLEAN HANDS," is notin reference to personal hygiene BUT a metaphor for our spiritual condition being cleansed from sin. (I John 1:9) IT SPEAKS OF A LIFE COMMITTED TO WHAT IS RIGHT AND GODLY ENABLING US TO STAND BEFORE OUR LORD IN THE PRIVILEGE OF WORSHIP.
original_verse_text: WHO may ascend the mountain of the Lord? WHO may stand in His holy place? THE ONE who has clean hands and a pure heart, WHO does not trust in an idol or swear by a false god.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, longing to stand in Your presence with clean hands and pure hearts. May our lives be committed to what is right and godly, that we may worship You in spirit and in truth. Cleanse us from all unrighteousness, that we may be found worthy to ascend Your holy hill and dwell in Your sanctuary. We ask this in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ. Amen.
reflection: Wherever we go nowadays, we see signs encouraging us to wash our hands. We see in these two verses that David spoke of the importance of clean hands, but for a very different reason. Here, “clean hands“ is not in reference to personal hygiene but a metaphor for our spiritual condition being cleansed from sin. (1 John 1:9) It speaks of a life committed to what is right and godly, enabling us to stand before our Lord in the privilege of worship.
subject: Clean Hands
verse_text: WHO may ascend the mountain of the Lord? WHO may stand in His holy place? THE ONE who has clean hands and a pure heart, WHO does not trust in an idol or swear by a false god.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 6/30/19:_I am with you and will watch over you wherever yo
go, and I will__bring you back to this land. I will not leave you
until I have done__what I have promised you._ (Gen. 28:15) READ (Ps.
25:4-10)THOUGHT FOR TODAY:Why do we so often try to go it alone in
life when at every momentwe have access to God? Didn't He say: "I am
with you and will watchover you wherever you go?" (Gen 28:15) Doesn't
He also assure us:that "He will never leave us or forsake? (Heb.
13:5). What a comfort to know that God is always with us--we don't
need to go through life alone. GOD'S PRESENCE BRING GREAT COMFORT._
PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: Why do we so often try to go it alone in life when at every momentwe have access to God? Didn't He say: "I am with you and will watchover you wherever you go?" (Genesis 28:15) Doesn't He also assure us:that "He will never leave us or forsake? (Hebrews 13:5). What a comfort to know that God is always with us--we don't need to go through life alone. GOD'S PRESENCE BRING GREAT COMFORT.
original_verse_text: I am with you and will watch over you wherever you go, and I will bring you back to this land. I will not leave you until I have done what I have promised you.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging Your constant presence in our lives. As we navigate the journey of life, help us to remember Your promise to be with us wherever we go. May we find comfort in the assurance that You will never leave us or forsake us. Guide us, Lord, in Your ways, that we may walk in Your truth and experience the fullness of Your steadfast love. We trust in Your unfailing guidance, for You alone are the source of our strength and salvation. Amen.
reflection: Why do we so often try to go it alone in life when at every moment we have access to God? Didn't He say: “I am with you and will watch over you wherever you go?“ (Genesis 28:15) Doesn't He also assure us that “He will never leave us or forsake us?“ (Hebrews 13:5). What a comfort to know that God is always with us--we don't need to go through life alone. God's presence brings great comfort.
subject: Always with You
verse_text: I am with you and will watch over you wherever you go, and I will bring you back to this land. I will not leave you until I have done what I have promised you.

original_content:
VERSE FOR 7/1/19:

_Test me, Lord, and try me, examine my heart and my mind. _(Ps. 26:2)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Mark Twain once said "Always do right. This will gratify some people

and astonish the rest." There is a lot of truth in that statement.
People

are often surprised when someone does what is right. Doing what's
right

IS NOT a new idea. David finally realized what it took to walk in
integrity.

What will; doing right cost you? Some worldly entertainment? Some

money at tax time? Some travel time on the highway because you obeyed

the speed limit? Are any of these things worth more than honoring the

Lord with your integrity? _THEY WHO DO NOT LIVE UP TO THEIR IDEALS
SOON_

_FIND THAT THEY HAVE LOST THEM._

_ PASTOR AL _
original_reflection_text: Mark Twain once said "Always do right. This will gratify some people and astonish the rest." There is a lot of truth in that statement. People are often surprised when someone does what is right. Doing what's right IS NOT a new idea. David finally realized what it took to walk in integrity. What will; doing right cost you? Some worldly entertainment? Some money at tax time? Some travel time on the highway because you obeyed the speed limit? Are any of these things worth more than honoring the Lord with your integrity? THEY WHO DO NOT LIVE UP TO THEIR IDEALS SOON FIND THAT THEY HAVE LOST THEM.
original_verse_text: Test me, Lord, and try me, examine my heart and my mind.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking to walk in the light of Your truth. Search us, O Lord, and know our hearts; test us and know our anxious thoughts (Psalm 26:2). Grant us the courage to do what is right, even when it may cost us worldly pleasures or conveniences. Help us to honor You with our integrity, for it is more valuable than any earthly treasure. May our lives be a testament to Your goodness, that we may gratify those who love You and astonish the rest. In Your holy name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: Mark Twain once said “Always do right. This will gratify some people and astonish the rest.“ There is a lot of truth in that statement. People are often surprised when someone does what is right. Doing what's right IS NOT a new idea. David finally realized what it took to walk in integrity. What will; doing right cost you? Some worldly entertainment? Some money at tax time? Some travel time on the highway because you obeyed the speed limit? Are any of these things worth more than honoring the Lord with your integrity? THEY WHO DO NOT LIVE UP TO THEIR IDEALS SOON FIND THAT THEY HAVE LOST THEM.
subject: Always Do Right
verse_text: Test me, Lord, and try me, examine my heart and my mind.
